New Records: Shubman Gill scored his maiden T20I century and became the 5th Indian to score centuries across formats.
India registered their biggest ever win in terms of runs in T20I format with a 168-run victory over New Zealand.
It was also the biggest margin of victory in a T20I match between two full member teams.
Shubman Gill's 126 off 63 balls is the highest individual T20I score by an Indian.
Key Match Events: Shubman Gill scored a maiden century, remaining unbeaten on 126 off 63 balls.
Hardik Pandya produced an all-round show, scoring 30 off 17 balls and taking 4 wickets for 16 runs.
India posted a huge 234 for 4 in their 20 overs.
New Zealand had a disastrous start, losing four wickets in the first three overs.
Hardik Pandya gave India an early breakthrough by removing Finn Allen.
Arshdeep Singh bowled a double-wicket over, dismissing Devon Conway and Mark Chapman.
New Zealand were eventually bundled out for just 66 in 12.1 overs.
Indian bowlers performed in unison with Arshdeep Singh, Umran Malik, and Shivam Mavi each taking 2 wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The start was far from rosy for India after electing to bat as Mitchell Santner made a master-stroke decision by handing Michael Bracewell the second over, who removed Ishan Kishan.
Gill reached his maiden T20I fifty off 35 balls.
Gill brought up his century with a four over the mid-off fielder off the bowling of Lockie Ferguson.
Gill continued with his attacking shots after the ton, finding the boundaries at will as the New Zealand attack looked listless.
